channel.title: Comments on: Wireless Radio
channel.description: Group Project Site for SEng466 at the University of Victoria

item.title: By: Mayra
item.dc:creator: Mayra
item.description:
Hey there, I think your blog might be having browser compatibility issues.
When I look at your blog site in Safari, it looks fine but when opening in Internet Explorer, it has some overlapping. I just wanted to give you a quick heads up! Other then that, awesome blog!
item.content:encoded:
Hey there, I think your blog might be having browser compatibility issues.

When I look at your blog site in Safari, it looks fine but when opening in Internet Explorer, it has some
overlapping. I just wanted to give you a quick heads up!
Other then that, awesome blog!

item.title: By: faramarz
item.dc:creator: faramarz
item.description: how can i use xbee to control quadcopter ? is there any chance to work ??
item.content:encoded: how can i use xbee to control quadcopter ? is there any chance to work ??

item.title: By: Garrett
item.dc:creator: Garrett
item.description: According to the data sheet: Software selectable channel from 2400MHz to 2525MHz (125 Selectable channels).
item.content:encoded:
According to the data sheet:
Software selectable channel from 2400MHz to 2525MHz (125 Selectable channels).

item.title: By: Garrett
item.dc:creator: Garrett
item.description: This actually isn't a controller; it's a wireless radio that can transfer digital data which I hacked to control the copter eventually. Technically, there are no channels in the way you are thinking, only different addresses. I would not recommend it to control a quad copter in general, but it was what we had to work with.
item.content:encoded: This actually isn’t a controller; it’s a wireless radio that can transfer digital data which I hacked to control the copter eventually. Technically, there are no channels in the way you are thinking, only different addresses. I would not recommend it to control a quad copter in general, but it was what we had to work with.

item.content:encoded: sir how many channels does this controller have?
